channel.title: [DELTA 317] - How to get out of a public void by clicking somewhere?
channel.description:
I've been working on a custom afk system for a while now, and I almost have it perfected.
At the moment you go afk after being away for a few minutes, and sit in rocking chair, barber chair etc (object ids) which freezes you in place for basically a million seconds (I put it under case 202 so basically instead of logging out you go into afk mode). To get out, you have to type ::back which unfreezes you and deletes the chair object.
I was wondering if any of you had some ideas as to how I could make it so all you have to do is click to unfreeze/delete the chair? Or to put it simply, How would I make it so clicking somewhere would enable my ::back command?
Thanks for Looking.

item.title: [DELTA 317] - How to get out of a public void by clicking somewhere?
item.dc:creator: @Beemobmo71 Beemobmo71
item.description:
@Beemobmo71 wrote:

Thank you very much, Got it!

Read full topic

@ohokay wrote:

Use the snippet of code that’s in your ::back command in the walking packet.
